    • Method Detail

      • allCustomers

        @RequestMapping(method=GET)
public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Customer>>> allCustomers()
        Query for all customers.

        This method is idempotent.

        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if customers found or HTTP 204 otherwise.

      • oneCustomer

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                value="/{id}")
public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Customer>> oneCustomer(@PathVariable @NotNull
                                                                                                                                                             @NotNull org.bson.types.ObjectId id)
        Query for a customer with the given Id.

        This method is idempotent.

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the customer to look for.
        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if the customer is found or HTTP 404 otherwise.

      • addCustomer

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> addCustomer(@RequestBody @Valid
                                                                                                                                                                                   @Valid Customer newCustomer)
        Create a new customer.
        Parameters:
        newCustomer - The customer to create.
        Returns:
        HTTP 201, the header Location contains the URL of the created customer.

      • updateCustomer

        @RequestMapping(method=PUT,
                value="/{id}",
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> updateCustomer(@PathVariable @NotNull
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    @NotNull org.bson.types.ObjectId id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    @RequestBody @Valid
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    @Valid Customer customerToUpdate)
        Update an existing customer.

        This method is idempotent.

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the customer to update.
        customerToUpdate - The Customer object containing the updated version to be persisted.
        Returns:
        HTTP 204 otherwise HTTP 400 if the customer does not exist.

      • deleteCustomer

        @RequestMapping(method=DELETE,
                value="/{id}")
public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> deleteCustomer(@PathVariable @NotNull
                                                                                                                                                            @NotNull org.bson.types.ObjectId id)
        Delete a customer.

        This method is idempotent, if it's called multiples times with the same id then the first call will delete the customer and subsequent calls will be silently ignored.

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the customer to delete.
        Returns:
        HTTP 204
